CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 25, 1946. pg. 9. reads: "Guests at Wedding - When Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Harold Richardon married on May 19 there weare many out of town guests. Relatives of the bride and groom whe came from far and near to attend the ceremony were, first row: Mrs. Walter Fulford, New York City; Lizzie Willis, Detroit; Charlotte Hall, Cleveland.  Second row: Walter Fulford, New York; Callie McGruder and Harris Lundy of Detroit.  Third row: Dorothy Hall, Ardmore, Pa.; Lela Eaton, Lansing, Mich., and Albert McDonald of Albion, Mich. - Harris Photos."Portion of article reads: "Miss Frenchie Hughes Weds Thomas Richardson - Miss Frenchie Odessa Hughes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. Oscar Hughes, became the bride of Thomas Harold Richardson, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Richardson, in a ceremony performed recently at 7214 Monticello Street by the Rev. R. T. Twiggs of Monumental Baptist Church.  The bride, given in marriage by her father, wore turquoise blue with a matching hat and fingertip veil.  She carried a white prayer book with a corsage of orchids.  Bridesmaid wears blue.  Miss Charlotte Hall of Cleveland, Ohio, was maid of honor.  She wore sky blue with white gardenias.  John Richardson, brother of the groom was best man..."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of men and women, including Bessie Richardson Fulford, Walter Fulford, Callie Richardson McGruder, Lizzie Willis, Lelia Eaton, and Lottie Richardson or Charlotte Hall, in front with Armelia West, Oscar Hughes, Jimmy, J.O. Hughes, Darryl Hughes, David Hughes, and Vivian Shelton, for Hughes - Richardson wedding, standing on steps of brick house with stained glass door, possibly 7214 Monticello Street, Homewood
